trans-unit.source:
\n

Determines the styles permitted in numeric string arguments that are passed to the Parse and TryParse methods of the integral and floating-point numeric types.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx $xxxxxx$Xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxx $xxxxxx$XxxXxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx$xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that the numeric string can have one pair of parentheses enclosing the number.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The parentheses indicate that the string to be parsed represents a negative number.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates that no style elements, such as leading or trailing white space, thousands separators, or a decimal separator, can be present in the parsed string.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xx x xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The string to be parsed must consist of integral decimal digits only.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx.
